column4: some keeps trying to give me a file transfer. Is there a way to turn those off? (I'm using GAIM)
I know I can use top to see cpu usage of my processes, but whats the best way to see how much memory each of the running processes are using?
top again
I tried looking for that in the manual 'cause i figured it might do it, but I got lost :(
top has it under %MEM
but how do I make it sort by mem?
you can't have it sorted -- because its varying every nanosecond
but it could be averaged out...
System monitor panel will say how much is used overall...
why dont you get a docklet that displays memusage -- that way you dont have to have top open
I do, but when my usage is high, it doesn't tell me which prog is using the most!
so I close the most common culprits until I hit the right one (Firefox with a ton of tabs, or rythmbox that has been running for a week, etc...)
sounds so like me
gnome-system-monitor
sorry for the delayed response. system-monitor doesn't tell you how much memory you have in your system just the percentage used. same with cpu
I think you might need to enable more fields for process view  -- edit > preferences -- the system monitor does display quite a bit of information about processes
yeah, but I want to see how much is installed in the system overall, not per process (this is separate from what I what I was looking for before)
many times I run the liveCD on a computer either given to me, or the people don't know what they own, and it would be cool to see how much mem is installed and the processor
the system tab on my system monitor tells me how much RAM and CPU i have -- but i'm running feisty -- so that could be it
you could always do this -- cat /proc/meminfo /proc/cpuinfo
yeah, I don't have a system tab, just processes, rescources, and filesystems. perhaps I'll have to wait till april.
thanks for showing me /proc/. I didn't know that was there
